summary: The document is a secret memorandum from 14 February 1977, detailing Nestor Antonio Moreno Lopez's involvement in anti-Batista and anti-Castro activities, his association with the CIA, and his role in the AMTRUNK Operation. It highlights his background, relationships with key figures such as Tad SZULC and Jorge VOLSKY, and how his indiscretions and distrust of the CIA compromised the operation's security, leading to his termination from sensitive roles. Despite his termination, Moreno continued his revolutionary efforts before eventually moving to South Carolina to teach Spanish.
key_findings: Nestor Antonio Moreno Lopez was active in the anti-Batista movement and later collaborated with anti-Castro exiles.
He co-created the Leonardo Plan with Enrique CAYADO Ribera, which became the AMTRUNK Operation targeting the Castro government's overthrow.
His connections with Tad SZULC and Jorge VOLSKY, coupled with his CIA distrust, resulted in security leaks within the AMTRUNK Operation.
Due to his failure to adhere to CIA directives and his indiscretions, Moreno was removed from sensitive AMTRUNK roles.
Post-termination, Moreno sought to sustain his revolutionary activities through alternative means before relocating to South Carolina as a Spanish teacher.
